newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Yeltsin spending weekend in clinic for checks.
newsitem.headline: Yeltsin spending weekend in clinic for checks.

text.p: Russian President Boris Yeltsin will stay in Moscow's Central Clinical Hospital for the weekend to allow doctors to carry out more tests ahead of forthcoming heart surgery, a Kremlin spokesman said.

He told Reuters there was nothing unusually wrong with the 65-year-old president, who returned from his holiday home near the capital on Thursday to begin a series of check-ups. It was simply easier for the doctors to work in the hospital, he said.
"This is not a situation created by an unforeseen event," the spokesman said. "There is no question of this being an emergency hospitalisation.
"It is the continuation of the planned checks since a number of tests and examinations can be effectively conducted only as an in-patient."

The spokesman did not say precisely when Yeltsin planned to leave. The president broke a long tradition of Kremlin silence on his health by announcing earlier this month that he would have heart surgery, probably at the end of September in Moscow.

His doctors said on Thursday after checks that they would meet again around September 28 to set the date of the operation, which they say will be a bypass to improve blood supply to the heart. Several foreign specialists are also being consulted.
